pullrequest.title: Add preserveFixedJoint option to the URDF parser

content.raw: Obviously I forgot to update the documentation once the PR was merged.
content.html: Obviously I forgot to update the documentation once the PR was merged.

pull_request.title: Add preserveFixedJoint option to the URDF parser

update.description:
The preserveFixedJoint option is meant to disable the lumping
of fixed joints by "preserving" the type of a fixed joint,
instead of converting it to a revolute joint with max and min positions limits
set to 0 .

This PR is fully backcompatible: the old option `disableFixedJointLumping`  is still working fine, but if on the same joint both the new option `preserveFixedJoint` and the old option `disableFixedJointLumping` are present, then the joint will be converted to a fixed joint. This is meant to simplify the life of model creators that need to support both the old version of Gazebo (and hence sdformat) without support for  `preserveFixedJoint` and the new version that can exploit this new option. 

Targeting sdf4 (as discussed in #!/osrf/sdformat/issues/131/disabling-lumping-on-a-fixed-joint-in-a) but let me know if this is ok . Documentation for the URDF extensions is not versioned with the software, but is instead available at https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_tutorials . Once (and if) this PR is approve, I will provide the correct changes in the documentation. 


See #!/osrf/sdformat/issues/131/disabling-lumping-on-a-fixed-joint-in-a
update.title: Add preserveFixedJoint option to the URDF parser

pull_request.title: Add preserveFixedJoint option to the URDF parser

pullrequest.title: Add preserveFixedJoint option to the URDF parser

content.raw:
Great catch! 

There was a similar error also for the `g_extentions` variable but it was fixed in #!/osrf/sdformat/issues/16/parser_urdf-accidentally-shares-gazebo . 
I think fixing this like the `g_extentions` case was fixed (a `.clear()` before the call to the function populating the structure) is relatively easy and can be done in this PR. 

However we should have an issue to make sure that to modify the urdf parser to be thread safe.
content.html:
Great catch!

There was a similar error also for the g_extentions variable but it was fixed in #!/osrf/sdformat/issues/16/parser_urdf-accidentally-shares-gazebo . I think fixing this like the g_extentions case was fixed (a .clear() before the call to the function populating the structure) is relatively easy and can be done in this PR.

However we should have an issue to make sure that to modify the urdf parser to be thread safe.

content.raw:
Thanks for writing tests for this. I notice 3 test cases:

* no options specified
* `disableFixedJointLumping` = true
* `disableFixedJointLumping` = `preserveFixedJoint` = true

Could you add one more test case with only the `preserveFixedJoint` option set?
content.html:
Thanks for writing tests for this. I notice 3 test cases:

  • no options specified
  • disableFixedJointLumping = true
  • disableFixedJointLumping = preserveFixedJoint = true

Could you add one more test case with only the preserveFixedJoint option set?

content.raw: It looks like this test has three distinct tests in it. Splitting it into three separate tests makes sure all of them get a chance to run when an `ASSERT_*` macro fails. This will give someone more info if there is a test failure in the future.
